Posts.Content: linapril wrote: Hi all, I am new to the breast cancer world and from the little I�ve read here, there seems to be a lot of strength in you women and I am hoping to be able to project the same � at least in the near future ! If anyone has words for me, I�m willing to listen. On 8/9 through a lumpectomy with sentinel node removal, my surgeon removed 3 cancerous tumors but the path report is 4 pages and confusing - only one tumor size on �diagnosis� area which states �the tumor is multifocal ranging from 1.3 to 0.5 cm maximally�. My surgeon is recommending a mastectomy because even with a combination of a mammogram, ultrasound or MRI, the ability to detect more tumors is not dependable. I am trying to weigh whether I should go forward or instead to radiation. Thank goodness my lymph node was benign. I am confused as whether my cancer, mucinous adenocarcinoma, is a type of ductal cancer or if is invasive. It seems that non-invasive cancer be a �better type� of cancer to have � but I don�t know much yet � does anyone else reading have this type of cancer? It may be a moot point for my decision but I am curious. The TNM on path reports pT1c, pN0(i-), pMX which I could state the tumors were beginning to invade and the node was negative. Is anyone familiar with this rating to lend some more info? I�m wondering if it is really for my own good, the need to rush? It sounds like everyone wants me to decide today and proceed in a week with mastectomy or radiation and I feel resentful and emotionally fragile of this rushing more than the whole issue of the cancer. Heck, I still have staples and stitches and don�t like being sore. I have yet to cry which surprises me. I will be going to see a plastic surgeon today to talk about reconstruction at time of mastectomy � if I really decide to. Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: linapril wrote: As my flight day is closer, I�m becoming more nervous about flying due to my arm, my hot flashes and comfort in general and I am due to fly on Wed for the first time since mast. Although my arm, discomfort, and tingling may not be lymphedema (is not according to my surgeon because I only had SNB) and LE Therapist says it is early stage & I may have something else going on w/my neck and shoulder, I want to be proactive since whatever it is, I do not like the feeling and as luck would have it, is bothering me more now. Is there special protocol for wearing sleeve during a flight? I don�t usually wear sleeve, only when inflammation is at it�s worst. TIA Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2006 02:41AM linapril wrote: Well it�s only been a bit over 3 days that I was angry for the feeling of being rushed to make a decision but I have definitely decided to have a mastectomy. (boo hoo � did I really say that!?) . � Yes I said it and I mean it and now just have to get used to the facts of it. Like one doc said � it�s like Las Vegas gambling, you stack all the odds in your favor and a mastectomy would be stacking the odds of living in my favor. And life is the big prize. Two and a half weeks ago I wasn�t even contemplating such heavy matters. Anyway, I appreciate all of your pointers to the best locations to find material to read and although I�m gonna be working extra hard at work and home next week, I plan to be on these discussion boards learning from you experienced girls. Oh I am SO glad you are here for me. But also sad that you've had to take this journey. I�ll call my surgeons office Monday and tell them the �news� as soon as I get up enough nerve to decide to do an expander placement (left side) at same time. And will ask for at least two weeks so I can plan � although that will make the surgery fall within days of my only child�s 21st birthday. But she is at college anyway so�.. Well since I�ve turned to ramble, guess I should end this. BTW � I am glad to hear about the options of stitches over staples. I hated the staples from the lymph removal and was so glad to get those out on Thursday.
Posts.Title: should choose today if mastectomy or radiation linapril gwenn
